et: French or Latin; French, from Latin {it}ridiculum{/it} jest
shortdef: the act of ridiculing : derision, mockery

pt: {sc}ridicule{/sc} {sc}deride{/sc} {sc}mock{/sc} {sc}taunt{/sc} mean to make an object of laughter of. {sc}ridicule{/sc} implies a deliberate often malicious belittling.
{sc}deride{/sc} suggests contemptuous and often bitter ridicule.

pt.t: {it}derided{/it} their efforts to start their own business

pt: {sc}mock{/sc} implies scorn often ironically expressed as by mimicry or sham deference.

pt.t: youngsters began to {it}mock{/it} the helpless wino

pt: {sc}taunt{/sc} suggests jeeringly provoking insult or challenge.
